Hwajinpoho

A trip to Goseong Drive in Gangwon-do, Gangwon-do and Lake of Ice in Spring

Goseong-gun, Gangwon-do, Korea

Deep in the heart, it is a eager spring. Spring meets Goseong, Gangwon-do, and the taste is different. National highway No. 7 along the sea is also in contact with the road to deliver the 'spring of the era' gift. At the end of February, families of separated families traveled along this path to open a spring of sea ice mood. It was the way to reunion in 3 years and 4 months. Goseong's March is still cold. The snowfall remains on the rugged mountainside beyond the representative attraction of Hwajinpo Lake. Still, a warm air blows between the traveler's footsteps and the seafarer's material. Just as the sea ice mood was held after the big and small accidents, spring energy began in the cold and trials. The spring that meets Goseong's port and lake is a wish and a wish.

Hwajinpoho, the backdrop for movies and drama
The way of sea ice crossing Goseong makes Hwajinpo a step. Along with the beautiful scenery, spaces to chew through the flow of the times are gathered around the Hwajinpo Lake.

The drama played a big part in Hwajinpo becoming a hot topic. The lakeside embroidered by the reeds set the background for the drama <Autumn Fairy Tale> and shook the hearts of the youth. A bicycle path was built around the lake, and it was a collaboration between Hwajinpoho and drama that Goseong, which was secluded except for midsummer, climbed the ranks of a date course in Gangwon-do.
Although it is not well known, Hwajinpo is also the place behind the movie <Piran>. If Song Seung-heon and Song Hye-kyo whispered the push of love in the drama <Autumn Fairy Tales>, in the movie <Pairan>, the scene where Chinese actress Chang Baek-ji gives a bicycle against the sea of Hwajinpo and misses Choi Min-sik is filled with watercolors. As the separated family's heart toward North Korea did, the story behind the sea is standing in the mud and lake. Hwajinpo's 'Hwajin' has the meaning of 'flowering naru'.

Hwajinpo, where there are villas of modern and contemporary characters
Dramas and movies are just fragmentary materials that enhance the atmosphere. Hwajinpo boasts its own elegance. Hwajinpo Lake, with a circumference of 16km, is the largest natural lake on the east coast. The pine forest is lush around the lake. In the fall, migratory birds fly to the shores of reeds. Quietness. If you express Hwajinpoho in one word, calm modifiers go well. It is not crowded or tumultuous, and there is still calmness in the lake.
Just across the road from the lake is the sea of Hwajinpo. Hwajinpo Beach is officially registered as the northernmost beach in South Korea. The color of the sand is white, and it has a reputation for being soft when pressed on. There have been many famous villas around Hwajinpo since ancient times. Hwajinpo is lined with villas of bold characters from modern and modern history, such as former President Syngman Rhee's villa, former Vice President Lee Ki-bung's villa, and Hwajinpo's castle, which was also used as Kim Il-sung's villa.

Aerial view of Naksansa Temple. Unique layout at a glance

Naksansa Temple, Yangyang

Yangyang-gun, Gangwon-do, Korea

Gangwon-do, where freshness goes and the clouds rest. At the end of last winter, too many snow clouds were resting. The ever-falling snow became a natural disaster, causing great damage to Gangwon-do. In 2005, a wildfire that came over in a strong wind hit Naksansa Temple. Ironically, it was Arbor Day on April 5. The forest fires caused Naksansa to be close to the battlefield. I couldn't help but be sorry for the sight of the burning of the cylinder and the melting of the same Joseon dynasty designated as a treasure. Naksansa Temple, which has risen again due to unfaithfulness, is still a sanctuary of seawater Kannon.
The Quan Yin Bodhisattva appeared during the unification Silla crisis

Before the founding of Naksansa Temple, I stopped worrying about studying in the Tang Dynasty and returned to Silla. He was anticipating the invasion of the Tang Dynasty, and there were signs of rebellion of the nobleman who had disliked against the unification of the Three Kingdoms. Above all, when internal unity was important, costume ambassadors heard rumors that the Gwaneum Bodhisattva was in Yangyang, Gangwon-do. Gwaneum Bodhisattva is a bodhisattva that relieves the sufferings of the rebirth, so the costume ambassador went directly to Yangyang. After praying for 21 days in the Gwaneumgul Cave under Hongryeonam, he was finally able to meet the Gwaneum Bodhisattva. The Gwaneum Bodhisattva said that bamboo would sprout in pairs, so it would be advisable to build a fire there. Where bamboo emerged, costume ambassadors established a cylindrical preservation. That's why Naksansa Temple is considered to be the best place to preserve it.

Center of Naksansa Temple, cylindrical preservation

Experts from the Cultural Heritage Administration and the National Institute for Cultural Heritage participated in the restoration of Naksansa Temple. Pine trees grown in Yangyang were used to restore cylindrical integrity. In the early Joseon Dynasty, Wonpyeongbojeon, a three-front style on the Palgak roof, has a sense of stability and magnificent energy like a central court hall with three columns on the front and three sides on the side. The closer to the maintenance of the cylinder, the more vivid the color and the more delicate the monochromatic, the more I don't know where to put my eyes. Just look at the rafters to see how much you've been devoted to.

Cylindrical Preservation and Seven-storied Stone Pagoda
Cultural assets such as the Geonchil Kannon Bodhisattva Statue (Treasure No. 1362), the Seven-story Stone Pagoda (Treasure No. 499), and the fence (Gangwon-do Tangible Cultural Heritage No. 34) are gathered near Wontongbojeon. The statue of the Geonchil Guan Yin Bodhisattva is inside the cylindrical preservation. The Buddha statue, which has a traditional style in the late Goryeo Dynasty, was created in the early Joseon Dynasty and is an important cultural property that still remains intact. A delicate expression such as a gentle expression, a slender finger, and delicate wrinkles on the clothes stand out.
Cylindrical preservation
There is a seven-story stone pagoda in front of the cylindrical preservation. The tower was raised from the 3rd floor to the 7th floor in the 13th year of King Sejo (1467). It is partially damaged, but remains intact until the metal fittings at the top of the tower, and you can see a crude double lotus pattern at the base.
Back door
It is said that the fence of Wontongbojeon was built when Joseon Dynasty recited Naksansa. Tiles and soil were stacked one after another, and granite with a circular cross section was placed everywhere. It is regarded as a representative fence of the Joseon Dynasty temple.
Cylindrical preservation fence
Around the fence, bamboos appearing in the founding stories grow. The line leading from Hong Ye-moon to cylindrical preservation is very different from the atmosphere of any of the temples where the traces of the years are felt. The clarity and vividness are felt everywhere, as if Sejo had been around and thought that the appearance immediately after heavy water would have been the same now.
Double lotus pattern at the bottom of the seven-story stone tower
Harmony between Naksansa Temple and nature, Seawater Gwaneumsang, Medical College, Hongnyeonam
Heading to the Seawater Gwaneumsang from Wontongbojeon, another attraction of Naksansa Temple awaits. It is the section from Haesu Gwaneumsang to Gaeseongdae to Hongnyeonam. It is about 20 minutes on foot, but just turn your head to stop the harmony between Naksansa Temple and nature.

Marine life museum in Taebaek Paleozoic Natural History Museum

Visiting the flesh of the Paleozoic Earth, geological tour of the Taebaek and Jeongseon Paleozoic

Taebaek-si, Gangwon-do, Korea

Taebaek and Jeongseon are deep in Gangwon-do, and are famous for their clean nature. It is not only the ecstatic nature that has been revealed that we have to pay attention to in the pure nature and people that have not been asked. It is also a treasure trove of geologists who can find traces of the ancient Paleozoic strata as well as under the ground and around it. The old land, the journey of tracing the traces of the earth in the old nature, and the geological journey between Taebaek and Jeongseon, crossing past and present, begin.

Geological history of 470 million years ago, Taebaek Paleozoic Natural History Museum
Taebaek is an old land. The place that clearly proves this is the Taebaek Paleozoic Natural History Museum and the area of the parliament designated as Natural Monument No. 417. Surprisingly, around the Taebaek Paleozoic Natural History Museum, 12 strata structures showing paleozoic sediments and biological environments are randomly distributed. It is said that this area, about 600m above sea level, was the sea near the equator during the Paleozoic Era. Evidence of this can be found everywhere.
Taebaek Paleozoic Natural History Museum
It seems no wonder that the Paleozoic Natural History Museum was built here, where traces of strata still exist, from 470 million to 450 million years ago. Before looking at the Paleozoic terrain and geology scattered around the site, it is the first step to take a tour of the museum. The museum commentator's explanation is kind to the traveler who is not good at geology.
Taebaek Paleozoic Natural History Museum Exhibition Hall

The Taebaek Paleozoic Natural History Museum is a specialty museum with the theme of Paleozoic era. It is not a boring museum that conveys only hard knowledge, but a living museum where you can experience the geology of the Paleozoic era while exploring the museum and its surroundings. Through an on-site experience with a commentary, you can see and feel the traces of the Paleozoic sea environment and marine life scattered around the museum.

Taebaek Paleozoic Natural History Museum Exhibition of Mesozoic
The first floor of the museum is an experience exhibition room. It is composed of various learning rooms that visitors can experience directly. Experiential learning is possible through play such as takbon, chromakey and fossil excavation. In the exhibition room on the 2nd floor, you can observe the pre-cambrian period, the electricity and the middle Paleozoic strata and various biomes. In addition, you will encounter the caves of Taebaek and the use of limestone, the fossil world, and the trilobite fossil. Finally, in the exhibition room on the 3rd floor, you can examine various flora and fauna of the late Paleozoic, Mesozoic, and Cenozoic eras and feel the nature of Taebaek and the seriousness of global warming.
Fossil of trilobite at the Taebaek Paleozoic Natural History Museum
It takes about 1 hour and 30 minutes to tour all the museums with the commentators. After roughly examining geological history and Paleozoic organisms, such as the changes of Paleozoic Earth and the appearance of creatures, you can now go out and face the traces of various geological layers and creatures directly in the field.
The Paleolithic limestone among Paleozoic geological structures outside the museum
A journey against time, a living Paleozoic discovered in Taebaek

After a 10-minute walk from the museum, you can encounter a variety of sedimentary structures that can observe the distribution and inconsistency of strata from the Precambrian to the Upper Paleozoic. It can be observed that the hydrochloric acid handed out from the museum is sprinkled lightly on this limestone zone. In addition, it is possible to observe various fossils such as trilobites, brachiopods, gastropods, and stromatolites, as well as sedimentary structures such as wave marks, salt marks, and snow structures that can determine the upper and lower structures of the Paleozoic era. This area, which tells the mystery of earth's history as well as its geological value, has been designated and protected as a natural monument.
When you see the Paleozoic strata and fossils with your own eyes and touch them and listen carefully to the explanations of the commentators, you can feel the modern self standing on the Paleozoic strata.

Along the road, along the water, along the footsteps, you will experience a new journey on the hillsides of Taebaek and Jeongseon that have crossed the Paleozoic and Hyundai.

How to spend a cool and pleasant summer, summer in Daegwallyeong, Pyeongchang

Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon-do, Korea

This summer, which was unusually hot, swept across the country, but only some mountainous areas in Gangwon-do, such as Daegwallyeong, were excluded from the heat wave. The temperature fell like a lie when I arrived at Daegwallyeong on the highway in the heat of over 30 degrees. The wind was cool and the air was clear. In the evening, I had to take out long clothes, and on some days, the temperature dropped below 20 degrees. It's not an exaggeration to say that I have been to the sea and the valley, but there is no summer resort like Daegwallyeong. Daegwallyeong, a place where you can forget the heat without a sticky energy, is the best summer resort in Korea.

From Pyeongchang Winter Olympic Ski Jumping Tower to Daegwallyeong International Music Festival
Daegwallyeong is not only cool, but also full of interesting attractions. The most popular place in the Daegwallyeong area of Pyeongchang is the Alpensia Resort, which will be the stage for the 2018 Pyeongchang Winter Olympics. Even outside the highway, entering the town of Hoenggye has a different temperature from the outside world.
First, let's take a look at the ski jumping tower, a landmark of Alpensia. The ski jumping tower, which was completed in 2009 and began to be opened to the public in 2010, is also the location of the film <National Team>. At the main stadium of the sports park, the ski slopes of steep slopes come in at a glance. The impression of the fact that the skiing competition will be held at the Winter Olympics is truly impressive.
You can climb to the ski jumping tower by monorail
If you can't get to the castle just by looking from below, take the monorail and go up the ski jumping tower. When you reach the tower for about 5 minutes, take the elevator again to the ski jump, sky lounge and observation deck. The ski jump stands on the 2nd and 3rd floors are for athletes only and are not allowed to enter the public. However, if you participate in the guided program, you can get down to the ski jump on the 2nd floor to listen to explanations and tour the facilities. Locks of love adorning one side of the observatory
Climb to the sky lounge and observation deck at the top of the tower, and you can see the Alpensia and other Daegwallyeong mountain streams. It is good to take a break while taking in the blue scenery. If you have time to get on and off the monorail, take a look at Daegwallyeong Ski Station located on the 2nd floor of the Main Stadium Basic House. Daegwallyeong Ski History Museum, showing the history of skiing

Alpensia Resort scenery with exotic atmosphere

Various works on display throughout the resort
The Daegwallyeong International Music Festival, unfolding in the hustle and bustle of the city and set against the backdrop of Daegwallyeong's green nature, is a touch of sweet classical melody. Scenery created by Shundae and Water Bun, Jeongseon Gumijeong Valley and Saulgi Village

Jeongseon-gun, Gangwon-do, Korea

Jeongseon Dumesangol is said to say 'you can hang a clothesline from this peak to that peak'. I am fascinated by the landscape of the Gumijeong Valley where I met a winding road. The Gumijeong Valley overlooking from the Saeulgi Village on the mountain is a masterpiece. Oh yeah! beautiful.
Where there are nine beautiful scenery
Even in the Jeongseon Valley, there is a beautiful scenery hidden in the remote areas of the mountain that needs to go further north. The Gumijeong Valley is said to have nine kinds of beauty.
Gumijeong Valley
After retiring from the official office during the reign of King Sukjong of Joseon, Lee Ja-ja left a sperm called Gumi-jeong. While setting up a pavilion, he named nine of the surrounding scenery as “Gumi”. The first is ‘어량 (漁梁)’. Refers to a landscape where a fish is placed on the water when a fish bounces to go upstream. Taebaek Snow Festival, a country of exhilarating snow

Taebaek-si, Gangwon-do, Korea

Taebaek, Gangwon-do, is home to the Baekdu-daegan, including Taebaeksan, Hambaeksan, and Manhangjae.
The snow festival held in winter every year in Taebaek is a festival where you can enjoy the beauty of Taebaek becoming a snow country. Enjoy the snow sculpture exhibition, snow festival program, and climb the famous Baeksan Mountain in Korea to see the beautiful snow flowers.
Taebaeksan Snow Festival <Photo Credit, Lieto>
Everything you can enjoy with snow and ice
The 21st Taebaeksan Snow Festival, where you can capture fantastic snow sculptures and picturesque snow scenes of Taebaeksan, is held at Taebaeksan National Park for 10 days from January 17th (Friday) to 26th (Sunday).
Fashionable snow sculptures, the core of the snow festival <Photo courtesy, Rietto>
The heart of the Taebaeksan Snow Festival is a magnificent yet delicate and stylish snow sculpture that reflects the flow of the times. The Taebaeksan Snow Festival, which marks its 21st anniversary this year, has diversified the subject of snow sculptures and expanded its scale to meet the various needs of tourists based on 20 years of know-how.
Fashionable snow sculptures, the core of the snow festival <Photo courtesy, Rietto>

Fashionable snow sculptures, the core of the snow festival <Photo courtesy, Rietto>

Hwangji Pond, Jungang-ro, and Taebaek Station are decorated with colorful lights and sculptures that attract people's attention.
Different things to enjoy at the Taebaeksan Snow Festival <Photo courtesy, Rieto>
Another festival-like fun, to Taebaeksan Snow Blossom Mountain
Taebaeksan Snow Festival is held at Taebaeksan National Park. It's a pity to pass Taebaek Mountain. What's more, if it snows, how much do you pass by the dazzling snowflake that has dazzlingly beautiful snowflakes and white snow!
In Taebaeksan, bright pink azaleas form a line in spring, and snow-white snowflake is spectacular in winter. The main peaks are Janggunbong Peak (1,567m), Munsubong Peak, and Busobong Peak, which extend from north to south. The trail to climb the Taebaek Mountain is largely divided into the Danggol Course and the Yuilsa Course. The billiard course has the advantage of having a lot of sights, and the only course has the advantage of being easy to climb for both men and women due to the gentle slope. If you climb up the only course and descend to the Danggol Course, you can enjoy the true nature of Taebaeksan Mountain.
Hiker crossing the Taebaeksan yew community
The only course can reach the summit in 2 hours or so, about 4km to the top of Taebaeksan Mountain. The steep mountain path from the ticket office to the only resting place leads to zigzag. It's a breathtaking section, but it's easy to go uphill to the Cheonjedan just to the only resting place. It is difficult to breathe due to the difficult climb, but the sky and the Baekdudaegan ridge between the forests gradually enter the field of view. As the summit approaches, it passes the attention colony of 'Alive, Thousand Years of Death, Thousand Years of Death'. The deep blue life is intense on the branches of attention standing tall in the wind.
Taebaeksan summit cover stone

After passing the attention colony, it reaches the peak of Janggunbong. At the top of Janggunbong, there is an altar made of stones. Together with the generals of Janggunbong, the bottom of the road to Yeongbong's Cheonwangdan and Busobong is also called the Cheonjedan. It is an altar established by ancestors for a long time to perform sacrifices in the sky. Even among the stacked stones, the snowflake blooms white and looks like a large igloo. Put the thrilling snow scene in your eyes and go down to Dangol Valley through Danjonggak, Mangyeongsa and Banjae. The Hassan Course is 4.4km and takes about 2 hours.

Taebaeksan Cheonjedan
500 km long journey of water, Hwangji Pond and Geomryongso
The Han River and the Nakdong River are the representative rivers of Korea. Taebaek is the origin of these two rivers, and the site of more than 500 km of water begins. The Nakdong River originates from the Hwangji Pond, passes through the gate to the Namhae, soaking the fields of Gyeongsangnam-do and North Korea, and the Han River flows from Geomyongso to the West Sea through Chungcheongbuk-do, Gyeonggi-do, and Seoul, the capital of Gangwon-do. The symbolism of the origin of the two rivers alone is a must in the Taebaek tour.
Nakdong River Origin, Hwangji Pond
Hwangji Pond is located in Hwangji Park in the center of Taebaek city. The large cover stone, “Starting from the 1,300-liter example of the Nakdong River,” indicates that it was the birthplace of the Nakdong River. The large pond inside the park surrounded by buildings is the Hwangji Pond. Hwangji Pond, which retains the legend of the greedy emperor, flows more than 5,000 tons of water a day to the south.
Way to Geomryongso

Geomryongso, beyond Samsuyeong, is 1.5 km from the entrance of the parking lot. The road is flat and the forest is lush, making it ideal for trekking. After meeting the trees that keep the story, such as mountain mulberry, hawthorn, yellowwood, ash, and ash trees, after passing through a small wooden bridge, a path leading to the forest of Japanese oak trees, often called larch. The snow scene of the Japanese oak tree forest road lined up in a row is beautiful. Geomryongso is spring water from limestone caves that rises to 2,000 tons per day. There is no freezing around Geomryongso with an average water temperature of 9 ℃. Even in the middle of winter, it seems as if the dragon is still alive. The stream that started at Geomryongso flows down as a small cow, and finally begins within the sea of the West Sea.

item.title: Enjoy the view of the canyon along the stream of the Nakdong River, the gorge train V-train of the Baekdudaegan - Taebaek-si, Gangwon-do, Korea
item.description:
V-train running through the canyon of Baekdu-daegan

Enjoy the view of the canyon along the stream of the Nakdong River, the gorge train V-train of the Baekdudaegan

Taebaek-si, Gangwon-do, Korea

The view of the gorge created by the stream of the Nakdong River spreads out of the car window. You will never see it when you travel by car. It is a scenery that can only be met by climbing the V-train and Baekdu-daegan gorge train. The pine trees growing in the rocks and the beautifully colored larch are as close to touching as you can. Let's get on a three-car train that will make your memories unforgettable.
The three-day V-Train that travels between Cheoram Station in Taebaek-si, Gangwon-do and Buncheon Station in Bonghwa-gun, Gyeongsangbuk-do three times a day, is a three-car tourist train that meets closely the gorge of the canyon created by the stream of the Nakdong River. Because it is a train that passes deeply through the V-shaped canyon, it has the name V-train. From Cheoram, you will travel by train for about 1 hour and 10 minutes from Seokpo Station and Seungbu Station to Yangwon Station and Bidong Station to reach Buncheon.
The picturesque scenery that stretches out of the window is only accessible by train. This is because Seungbu Station, Yangwon Station, and Bidong Station are not connected by road and cannot be reached by car. It is also the reason why many travelers make a reservation and take the Gorge Train between Baekdu-daegan. Taebaek Cheoram Station and Bonghwa Buncheon Station, where trains depart, are always crowded with excitement and excitement.
V-train running through the canyon of Baekdu-daegan

It is also worth taking a short trip to Cheoram while waiting for the Baekdu-daegan train departing from Cheoram. Cheoram is the largest coal mine facility in Korea built during the Japanese occupation. As coal was transported to the whole country through this place, many people once lived, but it is still as if the clock stopped in the 1970s. Around the Cheoram Station, there are murals depicting the stories of former workers at the Tantanjang and their families. When you cross the bridge in front of Cheoram Station, the empty houses lined up along the stream show an unusual scenery.

An unusual scenery around Cheoram Station
People who want to take the Baekdu-daegan Gorge Train at Cheoram Station are reminded of the expectation of a train trip. The appearance of the train waiting for travelers on the platform is also impressive. A locomotive that resembles a baby tiger that has been walking around Baekdu-daegan and a train with an exotic yet cute pink appearance catches the eye.
V-train waiting at Cheoram Station platform
The train interior is also different from the regular train. It is divided into two rows of seats along the car window and seats for two people to sit side by side. The ceiling was decorated with luminous lights to shine when passing through a dark tunnel.
V-train inside
There are only three trains, but there are also crews who are in charge of broadcasting and information, and there are also shops where you can buy snacks.
V-train crew
The train departing from Cheoram Station passes the simple station, Dongjeom Station, and speeds up to Seokpo Station. The full-scale canyon tour begins after Seokpo Station. The train, which ran at about 60 km / h, passed through Seokpo Station and ran at a speed of around 25 km / h, slowly pulling the scenery out of the window.
A traveler who captures the scenery spread out through the window
There are also various views of the scenery spreading out the window. Some travelers are busy moving to capture the scenery, while others sit there and enjoy the scenery silently. In order to record the itinerary as a video, there are people who leave the camera at the end of the train at all times.
Traveler with video at the end of the train
At Seungbu Station, famous for the phrase “three pyeong in the sky and three pyeong in the land,” you can stop at the station for about 10 minutes and feel the atmosphere of the simple station in Oji Village. The unexplored gorge reaches its peak in the section from Seungbu Station to Yangwon Village. The V-train runs along the stream of the Nakdong River, which originates from Taebaek and flows south, as if stroking the gorge of the gorge.
V-train stopped at Seungbu Station
Yangwon Station is a station called “the first private history of our country”. There were no trains in Yangwon Village located between Seungbu Station and Non-dong Station. In order to take the train, residents had to walk to Seungbu Station or Nondong Station.
Yangwon Station, Korea's first private-sector history
Residents who could not bear to buy cement themselves made a small history, and finally the train started to stand. At that time, the history and simple toilet made by the residents still remain.
Yangwon Station Simple Toilet
The scenery inside Yangwon Station, where small wooden chairs and old TVs bring back memories, is beautiful. There are also difficulties selling dried wild herbs, medicinal plants, potato rice cake, and corn. It's a busy time for a quiet Oji village.
The naval war in Yangwon Station
If you are a trekking traveler, you can also walk on the “Zermatt Road” from Yangwon Village to Bidong Village. It is also good to walk with two feet as a friend of the sound of the canyon. Although it is not long as it is about 2.2km, you can experience the harmony of nature with the valley and mountain path.
Zermatt Road connecting Yangwon Station and Bidong Station

You can write a simple note and leave it on the wall of a train, or buy a postcard to tell a story. If you put it in the mailbox on the train, it will be delivered to you in a month and you will be able to reflect on the memories of your trip.

Memo board that records memories of train travel
The V-Train now arrives at the final station, Buncheon Station, through the non-dong village where the villagers lived. Buncheon station and tiger dolls decorated with Swiss chalet atmosphere present another highlight to travelers.
V-train stamp on the postcard
As more and more travelers visit Buncheon Station, it is full of vitality in the quiet Buncheon Village. The villagers jointly run a restaurant to convey the taste and heart of the mountain village.
Buncheon Station decorated with Swiss chalet atmosphere

item.title: It's heat, I asked! Sokcho hot vs cool - Sokcho-si, Gangwon-do, Korea
item.description:
‘Hiyeolchiyeol’

It's heat, I asked! Sokcho hot vs cool

Sokcho-si, Gangwon-do, Korea

In the summer, when it is easy to lose your appetite, let's go to Sokcho, which will stimulate your appetite with various foods. You can overcome the heat while eating hot food with the spirit of 'heated heat', or you can blow the heat with cool, sparkling food. On a steamy day like these days, if you can enjoy a meal with a delicious meal, whether hot or cold, you will be grateful.
Introducing the hot and cool foods that make use of the characteristics of Sokcho, the home of displaced people and full of fresh seafood.
'Sleep Ice Dongdong', a cool marine exhibition
Hamheung Naengmyeon and Naejeon Water Association with cool taste
If you think of cool food in summer, maybe the first rank is cold. In Sokcho, Hamheung Naengmyeon has naturally been popularized since many displaced people from Hamgyeong-do settled down. There are still many famous Hamheung Naengmyeon restaurants in Sokcho. In addition to Hamheung Naengmyeonok, which was opened in 1951 and is known as the oldest Hamheung Naengmyeon in South Korea, there are several Naengmyeon restaurants with guaranteed flavors such as Ijo-myeonok, Wonsan-myeonok, and Dancheon Restaurant.
Hamhung Naengmyeonok, the oldest known Hamhung Naengmyeon restaurant
Among them, ‘Yangban Dak Hamheung Naengmyeon’, located directly opposite Hamheung Naengmyeonok, tastes delicious, but is made with healthy ingredients to make healthy naengmyeon. It was also recognized as a 'good restaurant' through the TV program <Food X File>.
Yangban Dakham Heung Naengmyeon is made with natural ingredients instead of chemical seasonings. Natural ingredients and formulations have been studied in order to preserve the taste of food. Myeongtaehoe, which is made with orphan meat and various vegetables, and enters Sokcho-style Hamheung Naengmyeon, is also seasoned without using chemical seasonings such as MSG.
Representative menus of Hamheung Naengmyeon and Water Naengmyeon
If you order Hamheung Naengmyeon, you can get some warm broth. Few people would respond to the first mouth saying, "Wow, it's delicious!" For those who are used to broth seasoned with chemical seasonings, the taste may be crisp. However, if I keep drinking from mouth to mouth, I can feel the timeless subtle flavor.
Hamheung Naengmyeon, made honestly with healthy ingredients
Noodles are also made with sweet potato starch and squid ink without adding chemical ingredients such as colorants. The firm texture of noodles is alive. The cold radish and the radish served together do not have a pungent taste. This is because 4 times vinegar is used instead of glacial acetic acid, which was used in a cold noodle house. The menu includes Hamheung Naengmyeon, which is served with boiled broth, and light and cold flavored Naengmyeon, as well as yukgaejang, galbitang, and meatball seasoned rice cake dumpling soup. In addition, Hamheung Naengmyeon + Panja, Water Naengmyeon + Panja set menu for those who only want to enjoy one, Alaska pollock on cold noodles, and Naengmyeon seasoning ingredients are also sold separately.
I kindly wrote down how to eat deliciously.
Another cool food you can taste in Sokcho is water sashimi. Among them, it is a unique marine war. The water sashimi using squid or ordinary sashimi is familiar, but it is a little strange to say it is a sea water sashimi. Sea water sashimi refers to water sashimi containing sea cucumber and abalone. In Sokcho, the famous place for naval warfare is 'Cheongchosumulhoe'. This house specializes in water sashimi and subsuk, making mulsu broth with fear of dead bone. It is said that Korean red pepper powder and fruits are added to the bone gravy, and it is used after maturing for more than a month in a ripening warehouse. The water sashimi, seasoned with fresh seafood on fresh broth stocked with ice cubes, is a delicacy in the summer. The sea water sashimi adds sea cucumber and abalone, which has a good flavor, and adds to the fun of chewing.
Marine war with sea cucumber and abalone
If you want to look inside with cold food and hot food, order Seopguk together. Seopguk is a traditional food in Gangwon-do and boils thickly with natural mussels (sop), oysters, mushrooms, and leek.
Noodles and potato rice cake are served
Hot abalone seafood pot and garlic soup
Sokcho along the sea is rich in seafood. So, foods using seafood are also diverse. The appeal of Sokcho seafood is the freshness of the ingredients. The hot food that makes full use of its merits is overturned. As for the restaurant name, Sokcho Abalone Seafood Ttukbaejang, the restaurant has only one menu. It started as a small shop at Dongmyeong Port and expanded the space while riding word-of-mouth. Nevertheless, it is often necessary to wait in line for a weekend. The pot is filled with seafood such as live abalone, scallops, shrimp, mussels, and shellfish. If you look at the seafood piled up on top of the earthenware pot, the mouth water will overtake. First, eat a scallop, make a space, and put a live abalone into it and cook it.
Fresh seafood goes into the pot ~
The secret of taste is that they insist on fresh ingredients. We do not handle freezing, but only the freshest seafood that comes in that day. In principle, both seafood and vegetables are supplied and used on the same day. When the prepared material runs out, close the door early.
‘Sinda Shin Restaurant’ where you can taste Garrik Gukbap
There is another hot delicacy that can be tasted in Sokcho, so it's Garibukbap. Garrik Gukbap, which is unfamiliar to us, is a favorite soup eaten in Hamgyeong-do. It is made by adding beef and bean sprouts, ferns, egg cuttings, and sauce to the bone gravy.
Garik-gukbap, popular in Hamgyeong-do
In Sokcho where there are many displaced people, there are many restaurants selling Hamheung Naengmyeon or Abai Sundae. It is almost uncommon for restaurants across the country to show off garit soup. After opening the business as Dashin Restaurant, the atmosphere of the abyss village, it was renamed as Shindashin Restaurant while remodeling the building.
Garik-gukbap, popular in Hamgyeong-do
Garit gukbap looks like a clear soup when first served, but when mixed well, the sauce is released and transformed into a spicy taste. Do not loosen the sauce, but rather taste the clear soup, and after eating some, mix the sauce to enjoy two flavors.
In Hamgyeong-do, the rice is rolled up in a soup to eat like soup, and after eating the soup, it is eaten like a bibimbap with seasoning sauce, ingredients, and rice.
Abai Sundae and Squid Sundae are also sold.
After eating a bowl of Garri Gukbap and resting on the beach in front of the restaurant, the heat seemed to fly away.

item.title: Takju factory, mill, refined trend of refinery, Gangneung upcycling spot 3 - Gangneung-si, Gangwon-do, Korea
item.description:
Willow Brewery, one of the best hot places in Gangneung

Takju factory, mill, refined trend of refinery, Gangneung upcycling spot 3

Gangneung-si, Gangwon-do, Korea

Sneakers made by collecting PET bottles discarded in the sea, tarpaulins for old trucks, airbags for scrapped cars, bags made of seat belts, and watches made from scrapped bicycle chains are sold at a higher price than ordinary products. Some are not available because they are limited edition. Literally, the junk is transformed into a masterpiece. In the world, 'UpCycling' is the trend. In Europe, upcycling crazes have been blowing in Korea since several years ago. Upcycling is derived from recycling, which means recycling, and refers to adding new values such as design beyond simply reusing discarded objects. Where is the fashion field? Upcycling spaces are emerging in Korea these days. Many places called hot places across the country are attracting attention by upcycling abandoned spaces. We can't introduce all the famous spots across the country, so let's start with Gangneung, the representative summer vacation destination. Trendy transformation of old Takju factory, mill, and refinery unfolds.
'Gangneung' beer, willow brewery at the old Takju brewery
First, I visited the Takju factory, which has transformed into a chic Brewery. In short, it is 'Bird Tree Brewery', one of the best hot places in Gangneung. This is the third visit in the past two months. It's a frequent visit that the employee asks, "Are you Gangneung?" I enjoyed the willow brewery leisurely with good timing. The third visit was on the Saturday of July, which entered the summer. I was anxious. I rolled my own hair. 'There will be few people who are looking for a Mack house from the early afternoon of Saturday.' However, the expectations were wrong. From Saturday afternoon, McDuck (beer Deokhoo) and travelers were filling the store. We realized the popularity of willow brewery and waited for a while before we settled inside.
The reason why we frequent the willow brewery, which is not close, is simple. The atmosphere is good and the beer tastes good. The biggest attraction of the willow brewery is that the elements that are unlikely to match are nicely harmonized.
You can see the brewing facility through the glass window.
The prettiness and trendyness, and the conflicting things of Korea and the West make a beautiful sum. It is a Western sake of beer, which is made in the Korean space where makgeolli was made.
Korean beer is produced in the Takju brewery space
This site was originally a Takju factory, with traces of time. Founded in 1926, it was the Gangneung Takju brewery that succeeded Gangneung Hapdong Brewery. The exact construction year of the current building is unknown, but traces of remaining objects are estimated to be in the 1970s.
Adding sensational elements to the traces of old buildings
The Gangneung Takju factory, which had been closed by students from Susuboria Academy, a brewing educational institution co-founded by Gyeonggi University and the Agricultural Technology Commercialization Foundation, was transformed into a beer brewery in 2015. In the space where fermented rice wine was fermented, beer is now ripening deliciously. The transformation from makgeolli to beer does not completely exclude Korean colors. Here, extremely Korean, 'Gangneung' beer is made.
Adding sensational elements to the traces of old buildings
You can tell from the beer name. It is unique in Minori sessions, Hasla IPA, irises, and Pine City Pale Ale. The Minori session is made using rice produced in Minori, Sacheon-myeon, Gangneung, and Changpo Ale is made with irises that symbolize Gangneung Danoje.
There is also a 'sampler' menu where you can taste various beers.
Hasla is the old name for Gangneung, and Pine City is the name of the slogan 'Solhyang Gangneung'. As such, the willow tree produces a uniquely strong beer that captures the local characteristics of Gangneung by utilizing the mission of brewery rooted in Gangneung.
Hongje pizza with kimchi is popular
Space is the same. The basic framework of the old brewery was preserved. Old wooden ceilings, shabby walls, heavy iron doors, old iron desks, and faded wooden window frames are the highlights here.
Full of vintage items
Vintage elements are not the end here. You can also see the clunky dishes and plates that you might have seen in your old grandmother's house, and the door-to-door television used as a cup and a water stand. Some of the tools used in the Takju plant remain. Strangely, the items that would be considered ugly become icons of 'cool' here.
Full of vintage items
Sarangbang, Bonbong Mill, where coffee is picked instead of rice cakes
I drank a glass of beer, so driving is prohibited. Find a place to go on foot. We steamed the neighborhood Myeongju-dong next to Hongje-dong, where Willow Brewery is located. I had to go once before, and I always headed for the sea. This time I decided to head to Myeongju-dong. Myeongju-dong was once a downtown area of Gangneung, but now it has become a secluded old city center. The moment I entered the alley, I realized. After all, the power of time cannot be ignored. The traces and stories that the years have accumulated silently captured the stranger's footsteps at one point. Myeongju Sarangchae, a small performance hall, and a few cute cafes were seen. Someone might say, 'Is this all?' It was good not to overdo it like alleys, which are hot places in Seoul, so the slow speed of the old alleys remained true.
Myeongju-dong's representative caffeine bonbon mill
If you come to Myeongju-dong, this is a must-visit place. It is a 10-minute walk from the willow brewery. I wandered for a moment in the alley and asked someone I met on the road to find the location of the Bonbong Mill. I think the local specialty is right. It tells the location at once. The name 'Bongbong Mill' is painted on a building with a pointed roof.
The first floor of a comfortable atmosphere like a neighborhood love room
Like the name, this was a real mill. It was once a place where people lined up and made rice cakes. In the course of the years, the mill was closed and left as an empty house for more than 10 years, and then in 2010, it made connections with people in the field of culture and art. After a year of manual space, the bonbong mill was opened in 2011, where coffee, culture and art and people coexist.
A cafe and a second floor space like a gallery
It's more stylish because it's unfamiliar with painted walls, old tiled floors, and old windows. It is comfortable because it is not decorated. The owner of the hand drip coffee greets the people in the village. Instead of plucking rice cakes and squeezing sesame oil, they just bake cookies and brew coffee. The Gentiles are also tied to the atmosphere and rest as comfortable as the people in this town.
Local artists' works are displayed throughout the year
All coffee is roasted and hand-dried. Coffee that has passed through the human hand and mind, not the machine, has a warmer sensibility. There are windows everywhere, and there is a work hanging in between. Even the scenery outside the ordinary window feels like a work here.
Works and props created by cultural artists are also displayed and sold.
Would you like a cup of coffee at the refinery? Coffee Refinery per Second
I was immersed in the charm of Gangneung's upcycling spaces. He shouted 'one more place for my best friend' and went to Chodang-dong, famous for Sundang tofu. I only went to eat Champon Sundubu and Chodang Sundubu, but today I head to the rice mill instead of the restaurant. Enter the side street slightly from Chodang Sundubu Village lined with restaurants. As we walk along the alleys of a cozy neighborhood, we see a shabby building with a wooden signboard called 'chodangjeongmiso'. Stop walking there where time has stopped.
An old rice mill turned into a cafe
I open the cafe door with the feeling of entering the refinery. The refinery machine, which still occupies a place among the owners, attracts attention. On the wall of the cafe, a transparent plate was laid and rice bran was filled in between. Although it has been transformed into a cafe, there are traces of it all over the place that you don't want to forget that this place was a refinery. Snow moves along the old trail, including uneven ceiling wood, refinery machine belts, and an old clock that seems to be telling no more time.
It is more special by keeping the atmosphere of the refinery intact
A record of 1963 is recorded in Sangnyangmun, which records the history of building or repairing a house. It is a fairly old building. In the days when food production was a national task, and during the time when rice paddies were built to fill the surroundings of Gyeongpo Lake, the Chodangjeongso was an important space for cultivating rice in this town. As the world changed over the years, Chodangjeongmi, which was filled with people, closed.
There are traces of the refinery inside and outside the cafe.
The owner, who is a native of Chodang-dong, was sorry that the place of memories, Jeongmiso, disappeared. So, he took over Jeongmiso and turned it into a cafe where anyone can relax. Of course, the traces of the refinery remained as much as possible. As expressed by the architect on the wall, the architecture of the Chodang Coffee Refinery was faithful to the role of `` Lessing less resources and leaving many memories. ''
There are traces of the refinery inside and outside the cafe.

The cafe is not finished just because the traces of the refinery remain. There are savory coffees and various drinks here. Also, the menu utilizing local characteristics of Chodang Sundubu Village is also noticeable. Chodang tofu banana smoothie, condibi cookie, condibi pound cake It is a menu created by the owner who runs the Chodang Sundubu restaurant nearby. It's a meeting between bean cake, cookies and pound cake ... . I can't imagine the taste of the combination. In this case, try eating it yourself. The savory and plain taste is attractive. The more you chew like rice, which is the main character of Jeongmiso, the more you sue it.

The reason why the upcycling spots in Gangneung met deeply is that the traces of heavy years and people's stories have been added to the space. This is because yesterday, where we live today wants to go back sometimes, remain in the space.

Coffee and bean cookies are a blend of fantasy!

item.title: A fragrance filled with tears, Goseong Honey Lavender Farm - Goseong-gun, Gangwon-do, Korea
item.description:
One day it rained

A fragrance filled with tears, Goseong Honey Lavender Farm

Goseong-gun, Gangwon-do, Korea

Your figure came softly like purple ~ ♪

Why did you sway 'You who came gently' to 'Purple'? When I was heading for Goseong Lavender Farm, I suddenly came across the lyrics of 'purple scent'. The thought that I've never had in my life has passed on this road, perhaps because my curiosity and anticipation about the purple world I'll meet soon dominated my mind.

Shinni Lavender Farm, a new world met in Goseong
The road to Goseong is long and rough. When you depart from Seoul, you must travel through Inje and Jinbu-ryeong for about 3 hours. Inje is the 38th border area that created "When and when you go to Inje," and Jinbu-ryeong is the stem of the Taebaek Mountains connecting Inje and Goseong. Novice drivers are even more reluctant because there are many winding roads. Nevertheless, there is a reason to head to Goseong. This is because it is now time for the lavenders of Hanni Lavender Farm to burst into purple flowers and create spectacular views. Lavender is a thankful thing to offer new sights in this poor season, where there is nothing but green to show until the foliage leaves. Knowing its uniqueness, people deliberately visit Goseong even on rainy days.
Rather, a watercolor
You must go through the ticket office and the herb shop to enter the lavender field. People who were curiously stepping on each other stopped at the entrance and made a short elastic. The landscape in the snow without notice is quite surprising.
Scenery that must be left as a photo
After seeing the appearance, he decided to try a different reaction, but eventually failed. The exclamation of "Wow" comes to the temple even in the landscape facing you.
There is no reason to walk fast
If the main character is a lavender field that looks like a purple carpet, rye and poppy flowers in a colony are excellent supporting roles that shine lavender. Buildings with traces of the paintbrush left on the outer wall are also the best backgrounds for this flower garden. The mist that came down to the mountain is nicer today. It is like a stage device that maximizes the dreamy feeling of purple. Anyway, it all goes perfectly. I've never been there, but it's like any country in Europe I've always dreamed of. A smile never leaves the strange feeling.
Rye field completely different from lavender
Walking around the corner of Honey Lab Farm
Let's go on a full-fledged lavender farm tour with an umbrella. Looking at the entrance, there is a lavender field on the front and right and a rye field on the left. The promenade is divided into two branches, left and right. The starting point on the milestone is the left side. Eventually, it is a course that returns to the origin and returns to the origin. However, there is a farmer's idea of drawing such a great picture on the canvas of the field, so I decided to follow it.
Bicycle wheels reminiscent of lavender and poppy
The size of the rye field is not large. Even the expectation of rotten and tender rye can be a little disappointing. At this time, the rye has been overgrown, so it looks like a rice that is ripe in yellowness. Still, it has its own qualities, so it's good to walk along a path. After passing through the rye field, you will be greeted by a poppy colony located outside as if escorting lavender. Each one seems to show off its splendor with a bunch of water on it.
A blooming poppy flower

On the other side of the entrance, Metasequoia stands like a folding screen. There are several tables and chairs between the trees, so it's good to take a break. Someone might think of words like 'unexpected' or 'accidental' while looking at metasequoia. However, it should be noted that this is also a landscape thoroughly calculated by the farmer. When the site was purchased, the landscaping farm, which was the owner of the original land, was given extra money to buy metasequoia. From the beginning, there was an idea to paint like this. Chestnut flowers are in full bloom outside Metasequoia Road. 'Isn't this too?' Think for a moment.

Metasequoia Road
Now it is time to observe lavender in earnest. Looking at the petals up close, the first impression is modest. Metasequoia and Poppy are very different from the ones that showed their greatness alone. It is much shorter than I thought. It's barely covering the knee.
The scenery is diverse, so it's fun to take pictures
However, the story is different in the vastly spread lavender community. The fragrance becomes darker and the color becomes more vivid. It's even more so if it rains like today. It is fluttering in the wind and creates a purple sea.
A leisurely stroll between mother chickens and chicks
It is not only people who cross this sea. Chickens and chicks raised on farms find food and take a stroll here. Even bees, which are hard to see in the city, have no time to collect pollen. If you listen with your eyes closed, you can clearly hear the happy singing of the bees.
Lavender tractor
It takes about an hour to slowly walk around the Honey Lavender Farm. On weekends where there is a lot of experience, it can be longer.
When the sky is more cloudy than the blue sky, my color is clearly displayed.
Efforts in the fragrance of lavender
Until Hanni Lavender Farm became a wonderful farm as it is now, there was a bloody sweat of Ha Deok-ho. Lavender was the weapon of choice for selling different herbal teas online. I traveled abroad and looked for scenes that could be modeled. As a result, the honey lavender lavender farm was created by partially referring to the lavender fields in Hokkaido. In 2002, even the word landscape farming was unfamiliar.
Herb Shop Products
Goseong, Gangwon-do, which was warm in winter and cool in summer, was selected as the best place for lavender farm. There was no place like this to grow lavender, which had poor cold resistance. A variety of plants such as lavender, rye, poppy, and white pink celix were planted by purchasing suitable sites. At first it was difficult of course. Few customers visited the Goseong Valley, but the investment continued to be unknown. Eventually, some of the purchased land was sold to increase lavender. Let's go to the winter kingdom Hwacheon to fully enjoy this winter.
Hwacheon's natural festival
Hwacheon is a beautiful country rich in mountain resources. Surrounded by Ilsan, Byeongpungsan, Maebongsan and Duryu, the Bukhangang River flows southwest of the county. In particular, Lake Paro is famous for its superb view of the lush trees that surround it. However, it did not receive much attention as a tourist destination due to the surrounding cities such as Chuncheon and Pocheon. One of the reasons was the relatively low accessibility due to the twisted national road and the limited development of tourism resources due to the military area.
In this situation, villagers developed a winter festival that reversed the closed environment. The main program is to catch mountain trout, a first-class cold water native fish, on the ice. Hwacheon's average winter temperature of minus 7 degrees made the burdensome content of ice fishing possible. The festival, which was first launched in 2003, was selected as the 'Festival Festival' selected by the Ministry of Education in 2006, followed by the 'Excellent Festival' and 'Best Festival'.
